timeline.bodyText:
Please try to put violation comment on same line where violation is. To follow 100 chars per line rule, some code can be shorter or wrapped.
You can make violation explanation shorter as well.
timeline.author: strkkk

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/whitespace/GenericWhitespaceCheck.java b/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/whitespace/GenericWhitespaceCheck.java index 890a18189..5590d816f 100644 --- a/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/whitespace/GenericWhitespaceCheck.java +++ b/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/whitespace/GenericWhitespaceCheck.java @@ -80,22 +80,14 @@ import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.utils.CommonUtil; * Examples with incorrect spacing: *

* 
- * // violation, "<" precedes a method name and is preceded with whitespace
- * Set<String> s2 = Collections. <String>unmodifiableSet(s1);
- * // violation, "<" preceded with whitespace when following type name
- * Queue <Integer> a;
- * // violation, "<" followed with whitespace
- * LinkedList< String> l;
+ * Box<String> b = Box. <String>of("foo"); // violation, "<" preceded with whitespace
+ * Queue <Integer> q; // violation, "<" preceded with whitespace
+ * List< String> l; // violation, "<" followed with whitespace
  *
- * // violation, ">" preceded with whitespace
- * Pair<Integer, Integer > p;
- * // violation, ">" not followed with whitespace
- * HashMap<Integer, String>h;
- * // violation, ">" followed with whitespace when preceding method name
- * Set<Number> s2 = Collections.<Number> synchronizedSet(s1);
- *
- * // violation under MethodParamPad, ">" followed with whitespace in diamond operator
- * ArrayList<Integer> a = new ArrayList<> ();
+ * Pair<Integer, Integer > p; // violation, ">" preceded with whitespace
+ * Map<Integer, String>m; // violation, ">" not followed with whitespace
+ * List<Integer> a = new ArrayList<> (); // violation, ">" followed with whitespace
+ * Box<String> b = Box.<String> of("bar"); // violation, ">" followed with whitespace
  *
* * @since 5.0

timeline.author: strkkk

replies.bodyText: Removed that part and put the example together with the rest of the > violations
replies.author: wltan

timeline.bodyText:
this line shows same thing as previous one.
Lets make it like this - one example for both '<' and '>'

is followed
is not followed
is preceded
is not preceded

So there should be total 8 lines.
timeline.author: strkkk
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -71,10 +77,17 @@ * MyClass obj = new <String>MyClass(); * *

- * To configure the check: + * Examples with incorrect spacing: *

* 
- * <module name="GenericWhitespace"/>
+ * Box<String> b = Box. <String>of("foo"); // violation, "<" preceded with whitespace
+ * Queue <Integer> q; // violation, "<" preceded with whitespace
+ * List< String> l; // violation, "<" followed with whitespace
+ *
+ * Pair<Integer, Integer > p; // violation, ">" preceded with whitespace
+ * Map<Integer, String>m; // violation, ">" not followed with whitespace
+ * List<Integer> a = new ArrayList<> (); // violation, ">" followed with whitespace
+ * Box<String> b = Box.<String> of("bar"); // violation, ">" followed with whitespace

replies.bodyText:
I think '<' not followed by whitespace and '>' not preceded by whitespace are always valid? So there are no examples that cause violation for those 2 cases. Good examples are already listed above this part.
I will reorganize the examples for the other 6 cases.
replies.author: wltan

replies.bodyText: Yes, you are correct, 6 cases are ok.
replies.author: strkkk

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/whitespace/GenericWhitespaceCheck.java b/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/whitespace/GenericWhitespaceCheck.java index 5590d816f..991a86f0f 100644 --- a/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/whitespace/GenericWhitespaceCheck.java +++ b/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/whitespace/GenericWhitespaceCheck.java @@ -80,14 +80,13 @@ import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.utils.CommonUtil; * Examples with incorrect spacing: *

* 
- * Box<String> b = Box. <String>of("foo"); // violation, "<" preceded with whitespace
- * Queue <Integer> q; // violation, "<" preceded with whitespace
- * List< String> l; // violation, "<" followed with whitespace
+ * List< String> l; // violation, "<" followed by whitespace
+ * Box b = Box. <String>of("foo"); // violation, "<" preceded with whitespace
+ * public<T> void foo() {} // violation, "<" not preceded with whitespace
  *
+ * List a = new ArrayList<> (); // violation, ">" followed by whitespace
+ * Map<Integer, String>m; // violation, ">" not followed by whitespace
  * Pair<Integer, Integer > p; // violation, ">" preceded with whitespace
- * Map<Integer, String>m; // violation, ">" not followed with whitespace
- * List<Integer> a = new ArrayList<> (); // violation, ">" followed with whitespace
- * Box<String> b = Box.<String> of("bar"); // violation, ">" followed with whitespace
  *
* * @since 5.0

timeline.bodyText:
Box<String> violation here is in right side of expression, so to make it clearer use '<' and '>' only in place where violation occurs.
For example, here it can be like
Box b = // here is code with violation
timeline.author: strkkk
timeline.diffHunk:

- * To configure the check: + * Examples with incorrect spacing: *

* 
- * <module name="GenericWhitespace"/>
+ * Box<String> b = Box. <String>of("foo"); // violation, "<" preceded with whitespace
